text: hello I'm David Pogue and it's that time
of year again the time of year when i
asked the camera companies in the world
the same question I asked every year how
much camera can three hundred dollars by
me when I started doing this in 2001 the
average camera had 2 megapixels a 2x
zoom or none at all double-a batteries
and no movie mode this year I rounded up
the very latest from Canon casio
fujifilm kodak nikon olympus panasonic
samsung and sony nowadays they all have
at least 12 megapixels a lot of them
have 10 * zooms like this new Nikon that
can be pretty handy but the big news
this year is differentiation all these
weird new features like this Samsung
camera has a second screen on the front
it's great for getting self-portraits
but that's just the beginning this casio
has 38 preset modes including some
cheesy but cool special effects this one
lets you put a subject into a different
photo
this Fuji has a special sensor designed
for low light and it really works smile
detection is a hot new feature this year
for example on this Sony it won't snap
until I smile touchscreens are big this
year too this is canons first touch
screen that lets you tap to zoom in or
shake the camera like this you go from
one picture to the next most of these
cameras can also film high-definition
video it's a big push this year but
beware very few of them can zoom while
you're filming and this Kodak is the
only one that can zoom excuse me that
can zoom both silently and quickly so
that's a lot of cool features but keep
in mind these are still basically cheap
little pocket cameras with all of the
attendant problems like shutter lag
check it out I'll try to snap on the
count of three one two three now if
you're one of these weirdos who thinks
that picture quality is more important
than touch screens and gimmicks then i'd
recommend the panasonic zs3 with a 12x
zoom beautiful high-definition and
stereo sound or the fujifilm f70 with
that special low light mode in a 10x
zoom but don't think that this is the
last camera you're ever going to buy in
just a few years these sophisticated
state-of-the-art cameras are going to
seem quaint and silly someday soon these
days are gonna be the olden days
